column3: str
What will you ask?
How are things?
What is this equipment you have?
Is this equipment for me?
Nothing.
Ever since ye showed me that crystal, me hunger for craftin' has been damn near insatiable.
In fact, I've been spendin' so much time in here, I think I might be breathin' me own breath... I s'pose that's the danger o' livin' an' workin' in a forge beneath the sea.
Maybe I should think about buildin' meself a little house someplace. All this constant hammerin' <Emphasis>has</Emphasis> brought in a fair share o' coin, after all.
Ever since ye came traipsin' through here, I've been reminded o' how bleedin' lonely it can get down here. Even sent a letter to the Crystarium.
I trained there in me youth, if ye can believe it. Made the damn near finest kettles Norvrandt had ever seen. <sigh> Good times, they were... Would that I could live 'em again.
Hmmm. Maybe I can. Not as a student, but a teacher. Aye, I could build a workshop, take a few younglings under me wing. Somethin' to think about, eh?
Well, I've been travelin' back an' forth between me workbench here an' the Crystarium. Seems when it comes to me regular work, I prefer to hammer away in a place what's set up just how I like it.

But I tell ye, there's no beatin' the world above for fresh ideas. That little project with Miss Chora-Zoi is as much for me benefit as it is for hers─I can already feel the seeds of inspiration takin' root.
An' the more time I spend in the Crystarium, the more chance there is o' Mistress Mowen payin' me a visit... Uh, I mean “us”! The workshop in town, that is! Purely for professional reasons!

Workin' so far away from me dear Mowen tugs at the ol' heart strings, aye, but life goes on. I reckon that's why I prefer the Crystarium over me underwater hovel these days─can't expect any visits from me beloved when I'm surrounded by sea slugs.

But ye heard the vows. Ours is a marriage born out o' love an' a mutual respect for our life's work. We'll keep on improvin', no matter the distance between us. Each time I gaze at me kettle, I know Mowen's thinkin' the very same.

Come to think of it, Miss Chora-Zoi once said she walked the smitty's path because o' me kettles. The fates have made it a symbol of hope for us all, it seems... Perhaps one day they'll inspire the whole bleedin' realm, just like our splendorous tools.
That shell of a crystal ye carry about... It tells a hero's tale. A tragic saga o' hope an' loss.

In me attempt to capture that achin' majesty in armor, I've poured me all into cloth, an' leather, an' metal─a “journey's end” for the memories what remain. An' if I'm ever struck by that same lightning, I reckon I can do it again.
Complete level 80 role quests to unlock Journey's End gear rewards for each respective role.
These works were inspired by the tragic tale of a hero, an' only a true champion can wield the legacy what's found at that journey's end.
But if I reckon ye've got the spirit an' the stones for it, I'll be happy to craft 'em for ye for free. Aye, I don't reckon I'll be able to stop meself...
Journey's End gear rewards can be collected for jobs in which you have attained level 80.
In the event that you lose this gear, you may speak with Grenoldt again to collect a replacement.
